intro: Borreria hispida, commonly known as the hairy borreria, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Americas. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in dry environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Borreria hispida is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
